CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 6, 1957, page 2, reads: "Protest Committee - Some of the citizens' committee which protested the unsightly and dangerous lot where school children sometimes play, at 31-33 Miller St., directly opposite the Miller Street School, have been fighting for 13 months to have the condition remedied. Left to right: Edward Hill, field secretary of the Community Councils; Mrs. Jane Giles, representative to the HDCC from the Miller St. neighborhood; Atty. Geroge Shields, chairman of the Neighborhood Improvement Committee of the Hill District, and the Rev. L. J. Freeman of the Miller Street Baptist Church. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Field secretary of Community Councils Edward Hill, representitive to Hill District Community Council Jane Giles, chairman of Neighborhood Improvement Committee of Hill District Attorney George Shields holding large book, and Miller Street Baptist Church Rev. L. J. Freeman, standing in interior
